link.title: District and School Closings and Alerts

div.p: Due to Governor Gretchen Whitmer’s state closure of all schools, Southfield Public Schools will be operating with staff working virtually from home.
All staff will continue to be available via email during this time. If you need assistance, visit our staff directory to send emails via the website.
Visit our COVID-19 webpage for the latest communications and resources for families.

p.a: Determination of Critical Infrastructure Workers and Essential Employees Performing Necessary Government Activities Notice

img.alt: Serving the Communities of Southfield and Lathrup Village

li.a: Community Eligibility Provision Questions and Answers

a.span: MI School Data Visit Our Dashboard

img.alt: Photo of students sitting at a table
img.data-fbpg-desc: High school student-athletes sign National Letter of Intent.

div.p: Southfield Public Schools understands that the state closure of our school buildings may result in hardship for some of our families who require food assistance. We will be offering up to two meals per day to all children ages 18 and under for free. This includes students with disabilities, ages 18-26, with an active individual education program (IEP).

Following Governor Whitmer's orders, there are changes to the operation of Board of Education meetings. Until further notice, Southfield Public Schools will be holding virtual meetings through the Cisco Webex video conferencing service.
Due to Governor Gretchen Whitmer’s state closure of all schools, Southfield Public Schools will be operating with staff working virtually from home.

td.aria-label: Click to view events for April 1

tr.td:
1 Apr 1 March & April Virtual Field Trips Calendar: Thompson K-8 Calendar PDF File Click Here for More Information 12:30 PM to 3:30 PM C.A.R.E.S. Food distribution Location: CARES in Farmington Hills, 27835 Shiawassee, Farmington Hills, MI 48336 Calendar: Levey Calendar

<p><p>&lt;p&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;C.A.R.E.S. of Farmington Hills, working with Gleaners, is offering a free food distribution for households with children. The mobile food pantry will occur on Wednesday, April 1, 2020. Guests without vehicles are welcome to walk up, but should be prepared to carry 20-30 pounds or have a cart.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;Please see the details below.&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;DATE&lt;/strong&gt;: Wednesday, April 1, 2020&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;LOCATION&lt;/strong&gt;: CARES in Farmington Hills, 27835 Shiawassee, Farmington Hills, MI 48336 (Please enter on Colwell Street)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;strong&gt;TIME&lt;/strong&gt;: 12:30 p.m. to 3:30 p.m.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</p></p>

7:00 PM to 9:00 PM
Regular Board Meeting
Location: Webex Meeting
Calendar: District Calendar
To join meeting please call 1-415-655-0001 and enter meeting number (access code): 472 742 380 or by clicking the following link https://oneoakland.webex.com/oneoakland/onstage/g.php?MTID=e7b83f5cdf7fe7517a945ce6a3d39942b. Any questions please call 248-746-4366 and leave a message and someone will return your call.
